title: Enhancing Patient Care Practical Competencies: Instructional Design Simulation for Elementary Information Literacy Development

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: They can present three specific criteria for evaluating information utilization skills in a textbook-centered learning environment.

Learners apply a 5-step process (needs analysis → content development → simulation implementation → testing → evaluation) to design information-seeking activities for elementary students (ages 8–10) in a VR simulation environment and submit ≥80% complete deliverables (requirements document, storyboard, test report, etc.) per step.
Identify and utilize at least five alternative information sources to reduce textbook dependency when designing learning activities
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
